title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Got an iMAC where the first LED Blinks on button press but not turning on.
Its not Q8450 and i have steady 12V
I'm not getting pm_slp_s4_l and not pulsing either.
is the criteria for s4 en same as macbook?

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
I can find anything about 820-3885...
If you have steady 12V_S5, what about 3V3_S5?

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
apologies, it's 820-3588
Yes I have steady s5 state

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
If S5 LED blinks when you press power button, means that 3V3_S5 is not steady.
So, do you have at least 12V_S5 steady all the time?
If not, check around Q/U6970.
Be sure 12V_G3H is stable.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
i meant that i have 3.3V for 3v3_s5 and 12v for 12v_s5 up till when i click the the power button and it blinks.
means voltage drops to 0 for both lines and go back to 3.3v and 12v shortly after

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
"Be sure 12V_G3H is stable."
If not, change power supply.

Check for short on all big coils.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
12V_G3H is rock solid stable, no shorts in all coils.

how do i d a smc bypass mode with an imac??

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Press and hold power button.
Insert power cord (previously removed) and release power button after 5-10s.
Then press power button again (shortly).

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
didn't know smc bypass works for IMAC as well.
well this time the LED didn't blink but stayed lit all the time. still no boot

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L, triggering SMC_ONOFF_L in SMC bypass mode.

See if all PCH's signals are present.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
1. PPVRTC_G3Hx   (VCCRTC) PP3V3_G3_RTC
2. RTC_RESET_L    (RTCRST#) RTC_RST_L
3. PCH_SRTCRST_L (SRTCRST#) 
4. PCH_INTVRMEN_L (INTVRMEN)
5. PCH_DSWVRMEN_L (DSWVRMEN)
6. SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTCX1 (RTCX1)
7. PP3V3_S5    (VCCDSW3-3)
8. PM_DSW_PWRGD    (DPWROK)
9. PP3V3_SUS    (VCCSUS3)
10. PM_BATLOW_L    (BATLOW#)
11. PM_RSMRST_L    (RSMRST#)
+1. PM_PWRBTN_L    (PWRBTN#)

checked all this and i have 3.3v for all this. no pulsing on pm_slp_s5_L or pm_slp_s4_L. i'm thinking dead PCH

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
"6. SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTCX1 (RTCX1)"
I suppose you've meant PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1.
3V there for sure?
In such case, other reason for bad PCH.
Should have 32KHz sine wave there.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: My mistake there for copy pasta~, for the SYSclk i have 32khz wave using o-scope.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Try changing PCH.
If works, need to clean ME at the end.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: got PCH replaced, turns on now, FAN SPIN... but no GPU_Good. need clean ME?

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
New PCH requires clean ME anyway.
But GPU should work with original BIOS; if not corrupted, of course.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: This board does not have dedicated gpu. Getting worries now lol

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Yeah GPU_GOOD comes out from PCH and means iGPU is in working condition.
Which is not your case; your board doesn't reach that state.

LED0302 is steady on?
Check if you get CPU core voltage (L7110/30/50).

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
ok did clean ME(First time though so many tutorials and each of them different) [URL='http://File']https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Cl5HcbQ3GCMmZpsEqtNbyOyHceFcg6YH/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

yes LED0302 is steady ON
and i'm getting 1.7V on CPU Core but it i'm getting no HEAT coming from the CPU.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
PLT_RESET_L comes high?
Try one memory module at time, each slot.
Also try full known good BIOS.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
PLT_RESET_L is 0v
same goes for the RAM, tried each slot and swap them with known good.
also flash with good bios same.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
You must get PLT_RESET_L high.
Seems that power on sequence is not completed.
Post U8600/1 voltages.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: U8600 all pins 3.3V except ground. same goes for U8601

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
So, both PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK are high.
What about PM_MEM_PWRGD?

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
PM_MEM_PWRGD is 0.8v

edit
PPVCCIO_S0_CPU and CPU_VIDSCLK is also 0v

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: so follow this chart for power up sequence [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/Bootup_Signal_Order[/URL] i'm getting stuck at CPU VR Ready that's why i'm missing LPC_PWRDWN_L. but i can't find CPU_VR_READY in the schematics.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
It is REG_CPUVCC_PGOOD (VR_RDY).
Should be high, as you get CPU core.

Check =PM_PGOOD_MEM_S0.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
so.. weird thing happened, system was running, fan spinning, as soon as i put my probe on R8430, it shuts down and reboot. this is repeatable, and no i did not short something out.

i leave my probe on the point, system starts up. shows me 3v3v. remove and probe again, shuts down

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Does the board boot in such condition?
Check for USB activity, or external video, if the board is alone on the desk.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: Sorry, system running as in I only have led0302 still no gpu good. And no cpu activity

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Yeah, difficult to understand a post, when is written in such manner.
I now suppose that you've meant to say the board reboots when you touch PM_PGOOD_FET_P1V35_S0 line with multimeter probe.

Has R8430 correct 22K value?
Do you get PVDDQ_S0_FET?

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
R8430  has 22k

i'm getting 1.34V on  PVDDQ_S0_FET.
the board reboots not only when i touch  PM_PGOOD_FET_P1V35_S0 line, it also happens when i touch R8535 pin2/PM_EN_REG_CPUVCC_S0 side as well

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: I supposed you get  REG_CPUVCC_PGOOD, but not sure now; you've said didn't find VR_READY.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: Yes i do get  REG_CPUVCC_PGOOD, yeah earlier i said i didn't know where on it on schematic. and i have 3.3v on this line

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
You cannot get away, without PLT_RESET_L.
Seems that PCH doesn't properly detect that power on sequence finished.

The new PCH may be bad, or broken traces/solders underneath.
Could also be a CPU problem, less probably.

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message:
Replaced another PCH. i have good news! i have PLT_RESET_L and my CPU Vcore is 1.76V
CPU Heats up so i know its running. 
BUT! i now do not have GPU_GOOD. no chime no display no light on LED0303.
only lights on at LED0302 and LED0301
Sorry man this is taking so long. i appreciate your assistance here

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: Did you flash BIOS again?

title: 820-3588 not turning on.
message: yes, i did flash again but still getting the same outcome.
